content: TitlTi Singaporean independent television production company **Wawa Pictures** ([Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 哇哇映画; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *wā wā yìng huà*) is an [independent](/wiki/Independent_station) television production company based in Singapore. It has produced dramas such as *[Three Wishes](/wiki/Three_Wishes_(Singaporean_TV_series))* (2014), *[Crescendo](/wiki/Crescendo_(TV_series))* (2015), *[Fire Up](/wiki/Fire_Up_(TV_series))* (2016) and [*Doppelganger*](/wiki/Doppelganger_(TV_series)) (2018). Recent variety shows include *Markets in Asia* (2016) and *Sherlock at Work* (2016) hosted by [Quan Yi Fong](/wiki/Quan_Yi_Fong) and [Vivian Lai](/wiki/Vivian_Lai) / [Pornsak](/wiki/Pornsak_Prajakwit) respectively. On 14 November 2015, a [Xinyao](/wiki/Xinyao) concert *The Crescendo Concert* – an extension of the 2015 drama *[Crescendo](/wiki/Crescendo_(TV_series)) -* was staged by [Mediacorp TV Channel 8](/wiki/Channel_8_(Singaporean_TV_channel)), record label [Ocean Butterflies](/wiki/Ocean_Butterflies_International) and Wawa at the [Singapore Expo](/wiki/Singapore_Expo)'s Max Pavilion. ## History Founded by Malaysian-born producer Molby Low Kian Chye (刘健财), Wawa Pictures was established in Singapore in August 2007 by Singapore's nationwide [free-to-air](/wiki/Free-to-air) [terrestrial channels](/wiki/Terrestrial_television), [Mediacorp TV](/wiki/Mediacorp_TV) (formerly [Television Corporation of Singapore](/wiki/Television_Corporation_of_Singapore))'s [Channel 5](/wiki/Channel_5_(Singaporean_TV_channel)), [Channel 8](/wiki/Channel_8_(Singaporean_TV_channel)) and [Channel U](/wiki/Channel_U_(Singaporean_TV_channel)). Currently, its content is distributed to markets like [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia), Hong Kong, [Indonesia](/wiki/Indonesia), China and [Cambodia](/wiki/Cambodia). ## Productions ### Television series
